page.title: 06PERSONAL TRANSPORT
page.content: Almost every family in our survey has a car of its own;one or two hve a truck or a van.All the children are wellaccustomed to car transport,though very few come to school reguarly by car.They mostly walk,using a car only if the weather is wet.Most family outings,some of which involve long journeys,are by car. Shopping expeditions are also made by car.Several families have two qualified drivers,and several have two cars. Many children own a biycle,which is principally used as a toy rather than a form of transport.All the children ride their bicycles in their own garden,the local park or on the pavement in the vicinity of their own home.
